sentence.Network_en: He learned this song as an inmate at a Texas prison.

sentence.Network_en: The inmate outwitted his guards and escaped.

list.abs: without costume changes , the same actors played everything from prison inmates to news reporters , all in variations of the same all-black outfits .在不改变服装的情况下，相同的演员扮演了从监狱囚犯到新闻记者各式各样的人物，整个过程都是清一色的黑色套装。

prison officials in France have praised a scheme , allows inmates to keep pets , for having a positive effect .法国的监狱官员们推崇一个计划-让犯人养宠物，以此给他们带来些积极的影响。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (denoting a person who shared a house, specifically a lodger or subtenant): probably originally from inn + mate, later associated with in

entry.tran: 被收容者;监犯;(精神病院的)住院者
entry.def: The inmates of a prison or mental hospital are the prisoners or patients who are living there.

means.word_mean: 1. one of several resident of a dwelling (especially someone confined to a prison or hospital)
2. a patient who is residing in the hospital where he is being treated
3. a person serving a sentence in a jail or prison

sentences.en: One of the inmates has escaped.
sentences.cn: 被收容的人中有一个逃跑了。

jushi.english: This is a novel depicting the bitter sufferings of the inmates in a Nazi concentration camp.
jushi.chinese: 这是一本描写关押在纳粹集中营的人受苦受难的小说。

jushi.english: The report said that inmates were forced to live in dirty and unhealthy conditions.
jushi.chinese: 报告说囚犯被迫在肮脏、不卫生的条件下生活。
